intro: Sida editorum, commonly known as the common sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes. Sida editorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas.
